meanings.definition: An opening or hollow place in a solid surface
meanings.sent1: The mouse peeked out of the holes in the wall.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter filled the holes in the wood with putty.
meanings.sent3: The donut had so many holes, it looked like a tasty piece of Swiss cheese.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it had holes in it after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The holes in the ground were so deep, they seemed to lead to another world.

meanings.definition: A small or low place in a surface
meanings.sent1: The tiny holes in the fabric were hard to see.
meanings.sent2: The rainwater collected in the holes on the road.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found a cozy spot to hide in the holes of the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: His pockets were full of loose change and little holes of lint.
meanings.sent5: The dimples on her cheeks looked like tiny holes when she smiled.

meanings.definition: A fault or flaw in a plan or argument
meanings.sent1: The detective found holes in the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent2: There were holes in his story that didn't add up.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so bad, they were full of holes.
meanings.sent4: Her excuse for being late had more holes than a sieve.
meanings.sent5: The plan had so many holes, it was bound to fail from the start.
